name: Calm One HopTea
description: This is probably the most delicious HopTea, the sweet smoothness of chamomile suits the flavors very well. Citra hops.

name: Really Hoppy One HopTea
description: The flavors of this aren't very balanced, I find it overly hoppy but not delicious.

name: Green Tea One HopTea
description: Pretty good balance of very light beverage and good hop aroma. Mosaic hops.

name: Mile-High-Biscus One HopTea
description: Surprisingly delicious, I didn't expect to like the hibiscus, but it adds nicely to the aroma.

name: Hop Water
description: Very simple hoppy sparkling water, light aroma, good taste, refreshing. Grapefruit-y hint? Idaho grown hops.

name: Hop Splash
description: A tasty sparkling water, less citrus-y or sweetness, crisp and refreshing. The aroma is light, and the favor isn't totally balanced. Citra and Amarillo hops.

name: Hoppy Refresher
description: Very citrus-y more than hoppy, definitely refreshing and tasty as a sparkling water--but not really hop forward.

name: IPNA
description: Light, crisp, has good bitterness but weak on the aroma which brings down the feeling of hoppyness--however, much more tasty than an average non-alcoholic beer.

name: Juicy IPA
description: Marketed as non-alcoholic craft brew, this goes for beeriness and does a good job. Interestingly, the taste and aroma in the first few minutes is GREAT, but then it seems to gradually get sweeter and less delicious as it warms.

name: Stout
description: Really tasty rich stout.

name: Non-Alcoholic IPA
description: Pretty solid as a basic very light IPA substitute. Tasty, but almost more like a lager in favor.

name: Run Wild IPA
description: This is pretty delicious as an light IPA.

name: Free Wave Hazy IPA
description: Refreshing, tasty light beer-like light IPA. Crushable.

name: Lime
description: Billed as sparkling hop water with adaptogens and nootropics, this is the most expensive drink I have tried. I found it not good. Tasted exactly like a cheap lime bubble water, but slightly nasty.

name: Hop Water
description: This is a delicious beverage, with 3mg THC (in Minnesota). It has a nice aroma and some body, not trying to be an beer exactly, but something delicious with hops in it.

name: Organic Session IPA
description: A very tasty IPA substitute, basically just like a session IPA. Available in Canada.

name: 0.0% Premium Pils
description: One of classic popular german beers as an NA. Pretty traditional sort of NA, meaning pretty terrible--but I guess better than really old school ones from the 2000s.

name: Original NA
description: Really not a tasty beverage from my point of view. Something pretty bad about these old school NA beers.

name: Fresh Squeezed Non-Alcoholic IPA
description: Very hoppy, yet balanced good flavor. To me it seems not quite as beer-like as the Athletic Brewing offerings, but in a good way, as a slightly different genre of deliciously hoppy drink (that is similar, but not quite like beer).

name: Trail Pass IPA
description: Good flavor, but light aroma and light lager-like taste. This is the first NA IPA I have come across in 12 packs!
